definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: She was the only daughter and the youngest child of five.
sentences.chinese: 她是家裏的獨生女，也是五個孩子中最小的。

sentences.english: Despite the fact that she is the only child in her family, she is never babied by her parents.
sentences.chinese: 儘管她是家裏的獨生女，她父母也從不溺愛她。

sentences.english: The only daughter took as heir.
sentences.chinese: 這個獨生女繼承了遺產。

sentences.english: I'm an only child, but my boyfriend's brother added me as his sister.
sentences.chinese: 我是獨生女，我男朋友的哥哥加我爲他妹妹。

sentences.english: Marpessa was the only daughter of King Evenus. She was noble and graceful.
sentences.chinese: 瑪彭莎是國王伊萬諾斯的獨生女，她高貴優雅。

sentences.english: Mr Smith passed all his money on to his only daughter.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生把他所有的錢留給了他的獨生女。

sentences.english: She reposes her hope in her only daughter.
sentences.chinese: 她把希望寄託在她的獨生女身上。

sentences.english: A man had a little daughter—an only and much-loved child.
sentences.chinese: 一個男人有個小女兒，是他非常心愛的獨生女。

sentences.english: Growing up an only child, she longed for siblings.
sentences.chinese: 她從小就是個獨生女，渴望有姐妹。

definition: to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
first awakening of love (usually of a girl) (idiom)
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
